::Scorponok/Zarak::

Scorponok comes crashing out of the ground before the Maximals had time to get their underground geo survey equipment ready. Zarak returns to standing on top of him. Zarak is surprised to see a swarm of Predacons now attacking the city.

Zarak: Now they will see the power of a HEADMASTER!

Zarak leaps into the air as Scorponok transforms to robot mode. Although nowhere near the size it used to be the body still stands several feet taller then most Maximals and Predacons. Zarak transforms to the head unit and attaches to Scorponok.

Scorponok: Prepare for extermination!

Scorponok releases two more rockets at the city.

OOC: Elder fired on the Pred scout, just fyi.

Nic <warriorazure@...> wrote:                                  The hits destroyed a tower that fell off the city's edge, spiraling
 down until it crashed in the lake's waters, creating a small-scale
 tsunami.
 
 Deadfur: Fliers, report! What's the target's situation?
 
 Flier 1: We got him sir! There's a big Crater where he was and-
 
 Flier 2: Delete that sir. I saw him burrow his way under the surface.
 He lying in wait, I think. He'll strike again.
 
 Deadfur: Ground crews, do we have anything to make him surface again?
 
 Crew: Not much, sir. We can used thumpRES scan, though. It's used to
 do geologic scans, sends an explosion in the ground. Won't be strong
 enough to damage him, but maybe to disorient it and nullify its scanners.
 
 Deadfur: Let's try that, then!
 
 He received the message from Elder.
 
 Deadfur: Notice taken, My Lord Elder. Thanks for your assistance. This
 whole mess sure makes a change from just being a scout! [Back to his
 troops] Fliers, we got incoming Preds! We'll use the city's AA
 batteries, but we'll need target designation. Switch to Target
 Acquisition mode and give us some bull's eyes!
 
 ****
 
 Jotunn: Great, our ambassador's gone. Airtankers, get ready. On my
 mark, we rush at the city and take out as much as possible of their
 defenses as possible.
 
 Airtankers: Roger.
 
 Jotunn surveyed the battlefiled for a second. The presence of that
 intruder had taken away all the surprise in their attack, but he felt
 confident that the Airtankers could still take the city. He saw that
 the first attacker was nowhere to be seen and decided now was the time.
 
 Jotunn: Mark.
 
 The attack started.
 
 --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@...> wrote:
 >
 > ::Scorponok/Zarak::
 > 
 > Scorponok is moving about trying to avoid as much damage as possible
 but was taking shots from the fliers. To protect himself Scorponok
 burows into the ground somewhat and shoots another fusion blast at the
 city along with the two rockets he fired.(My last post with him. They
 should still be in flight.)
 > 
 > Scorponok completely burows underground to avoid the "rock drop"
 bombs. The ground is being ripped up above him.
 > 
 > Zarak has now crawled into a cockpit like part on Scorponok.
 > 
 > Nic <warriorazure@...> wrote:                                 
 Deadfur: Just great... How about a Minion attack while everyone else's
 >  at it?
 >  
 >  He opened the Maximal only frenquency.
 >  
 >  Deadfur: Troops, this is Deadfur speaking. We have a report of another
 >  wave of Preds coming in. We have to get rid of that giant bug before
 >  they get here, unless some of you can manage to turn him the other way
 >  around. For now, continue with hit-and-run. Try to sneak up on him and
 >  to plant some bombs there. Engineering, how's the shield comin' up?
 >  
 >  Officer: Slowly, commander. We don't have the city covered yet, but we
 >  do have defenses over the gravitaion nullifiers. It will take a lot
 >  before they shoot us down from the skies.
 >  
 >  Deafur: Good, keep working on it. Keep up the efforts, soldiers!
 >  
 >  The small fliers were buzzing quickly around Skorponok, strafing him
 >  with lasers and missiles, while higher up, a team was trying a "rock
 >  drop" technique. They were miles high above the Decepticon and
 >  dropping small but heavy bombs that would generate a bigger impact
 >  because of the altitude...
 >  
 >  --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@> wrote:
 >  >
 >  > ::Lord Elder::
 >  > 
 >  > Elder thinks over this change in events before opening a return
 >  channel to Deadfur.
 >  > 
 >  > Elder: You're not going to like it. I'm showing what appears to be a
 >  whole squadren of fliers and probably more coming your way. Since you
 >  are on site and assisting the Maximals I'm scrapping the 'no
 >  interference' order. I'm on my way and I'll try and get as much back
 >  up as possible.
 >  > 
 >  > Elder switches to an open Watcher channel.
 >  > 
 >  > Elder: Watchers, this is Lord Elder. One of our ranks is directing
 >  the defense of the Maximal City Relay. They are faced with a
 >  Decepticon attack and a coming Predacon assualt. They are to recieve
 >  are full aid. I'm going there myself. Elder out.
 >  > 
 >  > He closes communications and heads for the exit. Only Watchers know
 >  how to survive the harsh lands around their base. Avoid them.
 >  > 
 >  > Elder leaves Cryonosis in a small shuttle pod that will get him to
 >  the main land.
 >  > 
 >  > Nic <warriorazure@> wrote:                                 
 >  Deadfur got the message on the Watchers-only frequency. He was not too
 >  >  pleased with the news. As soon as he could, he opened a line with
 >  >  Cryonosis.
 >  >  
 >  >  Deadfur: Deadfur reporting. I'm assisting the Maxies in Relay as per
 >  >  emergency protocols and I'm directing the defenses against that
 brute.
 >  >  I require further instructions and backups, my Lord. Oh, and
 just how
 >  >  large is that coming Pred force?
 >  >  
 >  >  He ducked as something blew up nearby.
 >  >  
 >  >  --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@> wrote:
 >  >  >
 >  >  > ::Lord Elder::
 >  >  > 
 >  >  > Deep within The Watcher headquarters signals go off, waking the
 >  >  Watcher leader.
 >  >  > 
 >  >  > Elder: What in the hell?
 >  >  > 
 >  >  > He checks the monitoring systems that The Watchers have set up
 >  >  around the planet.
 >  >  > 
 >  >  > Elder: One of the Predacon camps looks like their mobalizing to
 >  >  attack Relay. Wonderful. Sometimes I think The Minions are easier to
 >  >  deal... What's this?
 >  >  > 
 >  >  > Elder locks onto a new signature.
 >  >  > 
 >  >  > Elder: It's Decepticon, but not a normal Con signal. Something
 new.
 >  >  Something different.
 >  >  > 
 >  >  > He opens a comm to his men.
 >  >  > 
 >  >  > Elder: Watchers: I believe a new twist in these Beast Wars has
 >  >  happened. I want Watchers at Relay ASAP. Do not get involved
 unless I
 >  >  order it but I want to study the battle there. Right now the Silver
 >  >  Wing Maximals are dealing with some kind of new Decepticon but it
 >  >  appears that Predacons are moving to attack as well. Elder out.
 >  >  > 
 >  >  >

 user panel and lay it on us.
 >
